results.title: 16mm news camera with Cosmicar zoom lens used by GTV-9
results.brief_description: Model 0. Manufactured by Mitchell Camera Corporation Glendale, California. Complete with added Cosmicar zoom lens 22.5-90mm and wooden tripod. Used by GTV 9.

constellations_primary.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_primary.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.title_for_label: 16mm news camera with Cosmicar zoom lens used by GTV-9
results.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. Three-legged tripods made from firm materials like steel and wood helped steady the kind of image that was collected in production vans for Cinesound Productions and Movietone News. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles, this model was an improved design on the earlier Mitchell cameras, which were widely used by film production companies like those at Pagewood Studios in Sydney, Australia. The Mitchell Newsreel Camera was a quieter alternative, making it less invasive on sets and in the field.
description_for_label: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. Three-legged tripods made from firm materials like steel and wood helped steady the kind of image that was collected in production vans for Cinesound Productions and Movietone News. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles, this model was an improved design on the earlier Mitchell cameras, which were widely used by film production companies like those at Pagewood Studios in Sydney, Australia. The Mitchell Newsreel Camera was a quieter alternative, making it less invasive on sets and in the field.

results.title: Sony Betacam BVP-3P
results.brief_description: Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period.

constellations_primary.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_primary.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

results.description: Electronic News Gathering – also known as ENG – is a term that emerged in the 1970s to describe news reporting that used electronic field production technology. ENG could refer to anything from a single camera operator to a production van transmitting from the field, as television departments moved to more immediate broadcast of news without having to wait for film to be developed. Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period. Interestingly Betacam continued to be used in a professional setting for much longer than Betamax lasted in the consumer market.
description_for_label: Electronic News Gathering – also known as ENG – is a term that emerged in the 1970s to describe news reporting that used electronic field production technology. ENG could refer to anything from a single camera operator to a production van transmitting from the field, as television departments moved to more immediate broadcast of news without having to wait for film to be developed. Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period. Interestingly Betacam continued to be used in a professional setting for much longer than Betamax lasted in the consumer market.

results.title: Type 2014K Image Orthicon camera
results.creator_credit: Films & Equipment Ltd., PYE Ltd. and Vinten
results.brief_description: Pye cameras were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.

constellations_primary.name: News on location
constellations_primary.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Films & Equipment Ltd., PYE Ltd. and Vinten
results.description:
In 1948, Australian audiences were introduced to television at the Sydney Royal Easter Show. The British electronics company Pye had brought its 405-line cameras and monitors to encourage interest in the new medium.

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.
description_for_label:
In 1948, Australian audiences were introduced to television at the Sydney Royal Easter Show. The British electronics company Pye had brought its 405-line cameras and monitors to encourage interest in the new medium.

While it would be eight years until Bruce Gyngell famously welcomed Australia to television, the Pye company was still essential to the burgeoning industry.

Pye cameras like this were used across Australia in newsrooms and in the field by journalists at GTV9 and ABV2. They are lightweight and compact, making them easy to transport, and they feature an extended focus range switch for extreme close-ups.
